705461f.title: Brooklyn: Lincoln Place - 8th Avenue
705461f.text:
Lincoln Place (right) at the N.E. corner of Eihth Avenue,
showina in a set of two views the Montauk Club. See History of
Architectual and Bldg. Trades, Vol I., of N.Y,, 1899. F. H. Kimball
was the architect. It is a copy of the Ca. D' Oro located on the
Grand Canal in Venice Italy. Dnder the fimures in View No. 2 is
this inscription ''1650- Wyandance - Suchane - Pamannack, his wife
and his son Wiankabone gave a deed to Lion Gardiner of Sagghrook,
east Hapton, Aong Island: July 13, 1650.''
About 1901
Views 1 and 2
Harper S Bros.
EAY BE REiRODUCED

705462f-a.title: Brooklyn: Lincoln Place - 8th Avenue
705462f-a.text:
Lincoln Piace, at the N.E. corner of Eighth Ave. TThis is a view
of the Montauk Club, No. 32 Eighth Ave.
August 2, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
